pullrequest.title: Fixed several bugs where custom zip groups were overridden.

content.raw:
Ok so I found one thing a bit strange:

I set `global1` to be in zip group 'test1'. Now I set `global2` to be `global1*5` this results in this automatically being assigned to a zip group named 'global1'.  I'd expect the zipgroup to be the same as `global1` ('test1'). If I set `global2` to be `global1*5` before setting `global1` to a list that is exactly what happens. Is this intentional?

Original behavior was that both would be in the same zip group with the name 'global1'.
content.html:
Ok so I found one thing a bit strange:

I set global1 to be in zip group 'test1'. Now I set global2 to be global1*5 this results in this automatically being assigned to a zip group named 'global1'. I'd expect the zipgroup to be the same as global1 ('test1'). If I set global2 to be global1*5 before setting global1 to a list that is exactly what happens. Is this intentional?

Original behavior was that both would be in the same zip group with the name 'global1'.
